coat_type.source: AKC: 'The Miniature Schnauzer has a hard double coat.'

dander_level.source: AKC: 'These breeds may be just what the doctor ordered for people with allergies.'

grooming.source: AKC: 'To keep Miniature Schnauzers looking their best, incorporate weekly brushing and regular grooming into their schedule.'

health_robustness.source: AMSC: 'We expect the Miniature Schnauzer to be a happy, healthy dog, energetic, with a great appetite for life and for dinner!'

genetic_risk.source: AMSC: 'Good breeders work to avoid potential health issues by using health histories, health screening, or even genetic testing.'

apartment_ok.source: AKC: 'Their adaptability makes them at home in the city or the country, as long as their people are close by.'

barking.source: AMSC: 'Their alertness and sometimes vocal nature makes them an excellent watch/alert dog.'

energy.source: AKC: 'The Miniature Schnauzer is a robust, active dog of terrier type.'

reactivity.source: AKC: 'The typical Miniature Schnauzer is alert and spirited.'

exercise_need.source: AKC: 'They are athletic dogs that need daily exercise.'

alone_tolerance.source: AMSC: 'They need to live as a part of their family, going where they go, doing what they do.'

separation_anxiety_risk.source: AMSC: 'They need to live as a part of their family, going where they go, doing what they do.'

adaptability.source: AKC: 'Their adaptability makes them at home in the city or the country, as long as their people are close by.'

child_friendly.source: AMSC: 'Miniature Schnauzers are generally good with children if raised with them from a young age.'

stranger_friendly.source: AKC: 'He is friendly, intelligent and willing to please.'

territoriality.source: AMSC: 'Their alertness and sometimes vocal nature makes them an excellent watch/alert dog.'

protectiveness.source: AKC: 'The Miniature Schnauzer has a natural protective nature that makes it a great watchdog.'

affection_level.source: AMSC: 'They are obedient and quick to learn, extremely devoted, very playful and very affectionate.'

independence.source: AMSC: 'They need to live as a part of their family, going where they go, doing what they do.'

playfulness.source: AMSC: 'They are obedient and quick to learn, extremely devoted, very playful and very affectionate.'

trainability.source: AKC: 'The Miniature Schnauzer is a smart, trainable, and cheerful little dog.'

working_drive.source: AKC: 'They are an inquisitive and competitive breed that can be quite athletic.'

behavior_management_need.source: AMSC: 'They delight in chasing (and sometimes catching) small prey; therefore a fenced yard or on-leash walks are recommended.'

mental_stimulation.source: AKC: 'Behind those dark, deep-set eyes is a highly intelligent dog who craves novelty.'

prey_drive.source: AMSC: 'They delight in chasing (and sometimes catching) small prey; therefore a fenced yard or on-leash walks are recommended.'

hunting_instinct.source: AKC: 'True to their Terrier nature, Mini Schnauzers participate in Earthdog trials.'

weight_kg.source: AMSC: 'A dog measuring 12" to 14" will usually weigh 11 to 20 lbs.'

height_cm.source: AKC: 'Both males and females can stand anywhere from 12 to 14 inches at the withers.'

notes: Some features lack explicit information in the provided sources, resulting in null values. For instance, 'noise_tolerance,' 'sitter_compatibility,' 'stress_sensitivity,' 'pet_friendly,' and 'lifespan_years' do not have direct data available. Additionally, while 'health_robustness' and 'genetic_risk' have associated information, the confidence is moderate due to the general nature of the statements.
